verses.text: But Job answered and said ,
Oh that my grief were throughly weighed , and my calamity laid in the balances together !\f + \fr 6.2 \ft laid: Heb. lifted up\f*
For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea : therefore my words are swallowed up.\f + \fr 6.3 \ft my words…: that is, I want words to express my grief\f*
For the arrows of the Almighty \add are\add* within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit : the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.
Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass ? or loweth the ox over his fodder ?\f + \fr 6.5 \ft when he…: Heb. at grass?\f*
Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt ? or is there \add any\add* taste in the white of an egg ?
The things \add that\add* my soul refused to touch \add are\add* as my sorrowful meat. \p
Oh that I might have my request ; and that God would grant \add me\add* the thing that I long for !\f + \fr 6.8 \ft the thing…: Heb. my expectation\f*
Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand , and cut me off !
Then should I yet have comfort ; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow : let him not spare ; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.
What \add is\add* my strength , that I should hope ? and what \add is\add* mine end , that I should prolong my life ?
\add Is\add* my strength the strength of stones ? or \add is\add* my flesh of brass ?\f + \fr 6.12 \ft of brass: Heb. brasen?\f*
\add Is\add* not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me? \p
To him that is afflicted pity \add should be shewed\add* from his friend ; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.\f + \fr 6.14 \ft is afflicted: Heb. melteth\f*
My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook , \add and\add* as the stream of brooks they pass away ;
Which are blackish by reason of the ice , \add and\add* wherein the snow is hid :

What time they wax warm , they vanish : when it is hot , they are consumed out of their place.\f + \fr 6.17 \ft vanish: Heb. are cut off\f*\f + \fr 6.17 \ft when…: Heb. in the heat thereof\f*\f + \fr 6.17 \ft consumed: Heb. extinguished\f*
The paths of their way are turned aside ; they go to nothing , and perish.
The troops of Tema looked , the companies of Sheba waited for them.
They were confounded because they had hoped ; they came thither, and were ashamed.
For now ye are nothing; ye see \add my\add* casting down , and are afraid.\f + \fr 6.21 \ft ye are…: or, ye are like to them: Heb. to it\f*\f + \fr 6.21 \ft nothing: Heb. not\f* \p
Did I say , Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance ?
Or, Deliver me from the enemy’s hand ? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty ?
Teach me, and I will hold my tongue : and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
How forcible are right words ! but what doth your arguing reprove ?
Do ye imagine to reprove words , and the speeches of one that is desperate , \add which are\add* as wind ?
Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless , and ye dig \add a pit\add* for your friend.\f + \fr 6.27 \ft ye overwhelm: Heb. ye cause to fall upon\f*
Now therefore be content , look upon me; for \add it is\add* evident unto you if I lie.\f + \fr 6.28 \ft evident…: Heb. before your face\f*
Return , I pray you, let it not be iniquity ; yea, return again , my righteousness \add is\add* in it.\f + \fr 6.29 \ft in it: that is, in this matter\f*
Is there iniquity in my tongue ? cannot my taste discern perverse things ?\f + \fr 6.30 \ft my taste: Heb. my palate\f*
